items.title: Chinese embodied AI startup TARS raises $120m in angel funding
items.summary:
- TARS, a Chinese AI startup, raised $120 million in an angel funding round for embodied AI development.
- Funding was co-led by Lanchi Ventures and Qiming Venture Partners, with participation from Linear Venture, Hengxu Capital, Aplus Capital, and others.
- Founded in February 2025 in Shanghai, TARS aims to use funds for research, AI model training, and technology applications expansion.

items.title: Otter.ai launches AI agents for meetings, sales, demos
items.summary:
- Otter.ai has launched three new AI agents for meetings and calls.
- The Otter Meeting Agent can answer questions using company data, schedule meetings, and draft emails via voice interactions.
- Currently available on Zoom, it will soon expand to Microsoft Teams and Google Meet.
- Enhances existing AI meeting assistant with natural voice commands and database-driven responses.

items.title: BMW partners with Alibaba to bring AI to China cars
items.summary:
- BMW Group partners with Alibaba to develop an AI engine for next-generation vehicles in China.
- Collaboration will utilize Alibaba's Tongyi Qianwen models and Banma in-car AI platform for enhanced smart cockpit features.
- The AI engine will debut in the Neue Klasse series in 2026, featuring improved voice interactions and in-car mobility services, to be showcased at the Shanghai Auto Show in April 2025.

items.title: India orders Samsung to pay $610m in back taxes
items.summary:
- India has ordered Samsung to pay US$601 million in back taxes and penalties for tariff violations on telecom equipment imports.
- Samsung allegedly misclassified “Remote Radio Head” components from 2018 to 2021 to evade tariffs, leading to no duties paid on US$784 million worth of imports.
- Seven executives, including VP Sung Beam Hong and CFO Dong Won Chu, face additional fines of US$81 million.
- The investigation, initiated in 2021, involved raids at Samsung's offices in Mumbai and Gurugram, where evidence was seized.
- Samsung denies wrongdoing, asserting compliance with Indian laws regarding customs classification.

items.title: Shareholders approve XL Axiata, Smartfren merger
items.summary:
- On Mar. 25, shareholders of XL Axiata, Smartfren Telecom, and Smart Telcom approved the merger.
- The merger has received regulatory approvals from various Indonesian authorities.
- It will create a new entity, XLSmart, serving over 94.3 million subscribers.
- XLSmart is projected to generate annual revenue of 45.8 trillion rupiah (US$2.76 billion) with an EBITDA of 22.5 trillion rupiah (US$1.35 billion).
- Axiata Group and Sinar Mas will each hold a 34.8% stake, overseeing the company's direction.
- Rajeev Sethi appointed as President Director and CEO of XLSmart.

items.title: Agritech startup Grow Indigo secures $10m
items.summary:
- Agritech startup Grow Indigo raised US$10 million from British International Investment (BII).
- The funds will enhance sustainability programs and expand carbon farming initiatives.
- Founded in 2018 as a joint venture between US-based Indigo Ag and Mahyco, Grow Indigo focuses on sustainable agricultural solutions to improve farmers’ income and minimize resource wastage.

items.title: Cisco, Nvidia launch AI factory for enterprise security
items.summary:
- Cisco and Nvidia have partnered to create an AI factory geared towards enhancing enterprise security.
- The initiative aims to integrate advanced AI technologies into enterprise security solutions.
- This collaboration is expected to address increasing cybersecurity threats for businesses globally.

items.title: OpenAI adds photorealistic image generation to GPT-4o
items.summary:
- OpenAI has integrated image generation into GPT-4o, providing photorealistic visuals and multimodal outputs.
- The model effectively understands the relationship between images and language for accurate visual generation.
- Trained on a combined dataset of images and text, it generates contextually appropriate visuals and can render text in images for logos and diagrams.
- Utilizing transformer architecture and diffusion techniques, OpenAI enhances pixel-level precision for practical image generation.

items.title: Ex-Meta exec’s Israeli cybersecurity startup secures $55m
items.author: Roi Tiger, Pini Pinhasov, Ophir Arie, Omer Singer
items.summary:
- Roi Tiger's stealth-mode cybersecurity startup raises US$55 million, valuing the company at US$400 million.
- Funding is led by Greenoaks, following a US$20 million seed round with Sequoia, Index Ventures, and Cyberstarts.
- Tiger is a former Meta executive; co-founders have relevant cybersecurity experience from companies like Medigate and Snowflake.

items.title: Dell cuts workforce by 10%, faces AI cost challenges
items.summary:
- Dell Technologies reported a 10% decline in its workforce for fiscal 2025, bringing headcount down to approximately 108,000.
- This reduction is part of cost-cutting measures, including limited external hiring and role reorganization.
- Dell expects challenges in its adjusted gross margin rate for fiscal 2026 due to rising costs of building AI servers in a competitive market.

items.title: Indian lab-grown diamond brand Firefly nets $3m seed funding
items.summary:
- Firefly Diamonds, an Indian lab-grown diamond jewellery brand, raised $3 million in seed funding led by WestBridge Capital.
- The funding will go towards retail expansion, enhancing digital presence, and R&D for new jewellery collections.
- Currently operates stores in Mumbai, Pune, Bengaluru, and Hyderabad, with plans to expand to over 20 locations within two years.

items.title: ID minister to summon ride-hailing firms over $3 Eid bonus complaints
items.author: Yassierli
items.summary:
- Indonesian Minister of Manpower Yassierli plans to summon ride-hailing companies regarding Eid al-Fitr bonus discrepancies.
- Complaints reported bonuses as low as 50,000 rupiah (US$3) for drivers.
- Issues raised by the Indonesian Transportation Workers Union (SPAI), indicating minimal bonuses relative to annual earnings.
- Yassierli announced on Mar. 25 that the ministry will investigate the matter before Eid al-Fitr.

items.title: BYD surpasses Tesla with $101b in 2024 revenue
items.summary:
- BYD reported a 29% increase in its annual revenue for 2024, reaching approximately US$101.1 billion.
- This revenue exceeds Tesla's revenue of US$97.7 billion for the same period.
- BYD began surpassing Tesla in sales from Q3 2024 and has led in unit deliveries since 2022, driven by strong demand and government subsidies in China.

items.title: Australian VC firm probes pharmacy tech startup over finances
items.summary:
- Sydney-based venture capital firm EVP investigates financial discrepancies at StrongRoom AI.
- StrongRoom AI recently raised US$17 million, valuing the company at nearly US$70 million.
- EVP has engaged legal and forensic accounting experts to review StrongRoom AI's financial records.
- The investigation has been escalated to law enforcement due to reported financial misrepresentations.
- EVP is committed to recovering its investment through all available avenues.

items.title: Foxconn invests $142m in Texas for AI server hub
items.summary:
- Foxconn, also known as Hon Hai Precision Industry Co., has invested US$142 million in Texas.
- The company acquired an 86.34-acre property and a 1 million square-foot building in Houston.
- The investment is reportedly aimed at expanding AI server production for North American clients, excluding Apple Inc.

items.title: Australian fintech startup InDebted expands into UAE
items.summary:
- Debt resolution company InDebted has launched operations in the United Arab Emirates (UAE).
- This marks its seventh market since its founding in 2016.
- The Australian-based firm focuses on digital debt collection solutions using AI for personalized repayment options.
- InDebted emphasizes digital communication channels such as SMS and email.

items.title: Indonesia’s stock plunge isn’t tech’s problem – yet
items.summary:
- On March 18, 2025, Indonesia's stock market fell 6%, prompting a trading halt, marking the lowest level since 2021.
- The Indonesian rupiah dropped to 16,642 against the US dollar, its lowest since the 1998 Asian Financial Crisis on March 25.
- Tech companies listed on IDX, like GoTo, Bukalapak, and Blibli, have largely avoided serious impacts, but investor concerns are rising regarding market stability and a potential budget deficit from new government policies.
- Experts express divided views on the situation; some see it as short-term turbulence, others warn of longer-term challenges, particularly for consumer-focused tech companies.

items.title: IBM plans to cut nearly 9,000 jobs in US
items.summary:
- IBM is planning to lay off around 9,000 employees in the United States as part of a global restructuring effort.
- The layoffs could affect multiple divisions, including the Cloud Classic unit, with a quarter of its workforce possibly impacted.
- Areas such as consulting, corporate social responsibility, cloud infrastructure, sales, and internal systems will also see job reductions.
- Job cuts are reported in several locations: Raleigh, New York City, Dallas, and California.
- This move may be part of a strategy to shift roles to India, where IBM is listing more job openings compared to the US.
- CEO Arvind Krishna has highlighted India as a significant talent hub, especially for cloud and consulting roles.
- The remaining US employees are required to return to the office at least three days a week starting late April, with monitored badge swipes.

items.title: Eli Lilly opens first biotech incubator in China
Neta Auto loses execs as it pushes into global markets
Nio adopts ROI-based management, targets profit by 2025
Where are SG’s ride-hailing drivers?
DeepSeek helps China narrow AI gap with US, 01.AI CEO says
These are the most active investors in Korea’s startups
French VC firm Daphni secures $215m fund for European startups
items.summary:
- French venture capital firm Daphni has launched its latest fund, Daphni Blue, with €200 million (US$215 million) raised in first closing.
- The firm aims to raise a total of €250 million (US$270 million) by year-end.
- Since 2015, Daphni has invested in 70 European startups and plans to fund 40 more through this initiative.
- Major contributors include Crédit Mutuel Arkéa, Bpifrance, the European Investment Fund, PRO BTP, and Swen Capital Partners.
- The fund will emphasize scientific innovation in life sciences, physics, chemistry, and mathematics.

items.title: Tesla’s market share drops in Europe
Kaya Founders expands portfolio with five startup investments
German medtech firm Amboss raises $260m
Israeli fintech firm eToro reports $192m profit ahead of IPO
BYD’s 2024 profit jumps 34% as new EV sales surge 41%
Shopee drops J&T Express’ standard, economy deliveries in Indonesia
items.summary:
- Shopee will no longer offer standard and economy delivery services from J&T Express in Indonesia starting in April.
- The change only affects Indonesia and does not impact other markets.
- J&T Cargo, a separate brand, will still be available for larger parcels.
- Shopee has communicated this change to sellers since March to ensure preparedness.
- Ten other logistics partners, including Shopee Xpress, will continue to provide delivery services.
- SPX and J&T Express previously offered the cheapest shipping rates on Shopee.
- Indonesia is J&T's second-largest market, delivering 4 million packages daily.

items.title: Seabank Indonesia posts 57% profit growth
Indian AI firm to invest $13.7m in first large reasoning model
items.summary:
- Mumbai-based Fractal Analytics will invest 118 crore rupees (US$13.7 million) for India's first large reasoning model (LRM).
- The company seeks 76 crore rupees (US$8.8 million) in subsidies under the IndiaAI Mission.
- 94 crore rupees (US$11 million) will be used to acquire GPUs, requiring 700,000 hours of computation over nine months.
- The LRM will consist of small, medium, and large versions, utilizing datasets from 2 billion to 1 trillion tokens.
- Aims to enhance AI infrastructure and model development with 187 applications received so far.

items.title: Not all e-bikes can make it on the road
Binance probes insider trading, suspends staff
items.summary:
- Binance suspended an employee for alleged insider trading linked to a cryptocurrency project on Mar. 25, 2025.
- The employee, from the Wallet team, is accused of front-running trades using non-public information from a previous role at BNB Chain.
- Binance announced a reward of US$100,000 for four whistleblowers who reported the misconduct.

items.title: An aspiring VC’s guide to managing LP relationships
items.summary:
- Managing relationships with limited partners (LPs) is crucial for aspiring VC fund managers.
- Almost a third of funds managing US$1 million to US$10 million in assets have 25 to 49 LPs.
- Raising capital is challenging, requiring engagement with many potential investors; for a US$10 million fund, it may take talking to 500 potential investors at a 5% conversion rate.
- Communication with LPs post-investment is essential to ensure they are informed about fund performance.
- Maintaining strong relationships can lead to repeat investments, making it easier to raise future funds.

items.title: Series SEA: Who’s investing in the region’s health startups?
items.summary:
- Overview of active investors in Southeast Asia’s health startup scene.
- List generated based on investment data from the past two years, focusing on firms that have invested in three or more companies.
- Acknowledgment of data limitations and encouragement for feedback on inaccuracies.

items.title: DeepSeek improves V3 model for programming
Chinese tech rally falters as Xiaomi, Alibaba stocks drop
Indian fintech startup Fisdom cuts losses by 19%
items.author: Anand Dalmia, Subramanya SV
items.summary:
- Fisdom reduced its consolidated net loss for FY24 by 19%, from $8.2 million to $6.7 million.
- Operating revenue increased by 28% to $9.67 million compared to $7.5 million in FY23.
- Total revenue for FY24 was $9.8 million, a rise from $7.8 million in the previous year.
- Total expenses saw a slight increase of 3%, reaching $16.53 million.
- Co-founder Subramanya SV reported achieving EBITDA profitability in the March quarter of FY24, with hopes for full-year profitability in FY25.
- Fisdom was founded in 2015 and has 1 million active users, managing $746.6 million in assets under management in mutual funds.

items.title: X engineering director departs as Musk reshapes leadership team
OpenAI updates ChatGPT’s advanced voice mode
TikTok global ad chief steps down in leadership shifts
items.summary:
- Blake Chandlee steps down as TikTok’s global advertising chief, transitioning to an advisory role effective Apr. 1.
- His team will merge with the global monetization product technology team led by Will Liu.
- TikTok aims for a 50% increase in ad sales by 2025.
- At least eight executives have departed TikTok since early 2025, including music chief Ole Obermann.
- TikTok faces a US government deadline on Apr. 5 to finalize its US operations sale.
- Oracle proposed a plan with security assurances and a minor stake in a new American entity for TikTok's operations.

items.title: Over 50% of PH startup deals in 2024 were from FDIs: report
items.summary:
- Over 50% of Philippine startup deals in 2024 were from foreign direct investments (FDIs), according to the Philippine Venture Capital Report 2025.
- 52.5% of deals last year were from FDIs, up from 36.2% in 2023.
- Local investors accounted for 23.8% of startup deals in 2024.
- The surge in FDIs indicates a growing international interest in the Philippine startup ecosystem.
- Fintech was the most active sector for investments, with direct-to-consumer and cleantech also noted as fast-growing sectors.
- The Philippines raised 19% of VC funds in Southeast Asia last year, an increase from 13% in 2023.

items.title: Infineon to set up semiconductor R&D hub in India
items.author: Jochen Hanebeck
items.summary:
- Infineon Technologies to open a global capability centre (GCC) in GIFT City, Gujarat, India.
- The centre will focus on semiconductor chip design, product software, IT, and supply chain management.
- The initiative is significant for Infineon’s growth in the Indian market.
- The GCC is expected to create 400 engineering jobs and support global R&D initiatives.

items.title: Alibaba’s chairman sees rising confidence in China’s business
items.summary:
- Joe Tsai, chairman of Alibaba Group, stated on Mar. 25 that Chinese entrepreneurs are becoming more confident after President Xi Jinping's meeting with private business leaders in January.
- The January meeting has encouraged the business community to reinvest and increase hiring efforts.
- Alibaba plans to resume recruitment, promoting job creation for financial security.
- Tsai is optimistic about the recovery of China's economy, indicating a stabilized business environment.

items.title: Chinese robotics firm Agibot targets 5,000 robots this year
Energy firm Fermaca plans $3.7b data, fertilizer projects in Mexico
items.summary:
- Fermaca Global plans to develop a US$3.7 billion data infrastructure and fertilizer plant in Durango, Mexico.
- The initiative includes the US$2.7 billion Digital City project, deploying 2,000 kilometers of dark fiber connecting Texas to central Mexico.
- The dark fiber network will be built in four phases over 15 to 18 months, with long-term contracts established for major tech and telecom firms.

items.title: Zepto plans $250m secondary share sale ahead of IPO
items.summary:
- Indian online grocery startup Zepto is planning a secondary share sale worth up to US$250 million.
- The goal of the sale is to boost Indian investor ownership ahead of its planned IPO.
- The sale will allow employees and investors to cash out shares without raising new capital.
- Motilal Oswal Financial Services and Edelweiss Financial Services are in talks to purchase shares in this sale.
- Zepto is valued at over US$5 billion, aiming to increase Indian ownership from 33% to 50% before going public in late 2025 or early 2026.

items.title: French VC firm Founders Future sells 25% stake to key investors
items.summary:
- Founders Future, a Paris-based venture capital firm, manages 300 million euro (US$324 million) in assets.
- The firm sold a 25% stake in its holding company to investors including MACSF, the Dassault family, and CMA CGM Group.
- Founders Future aims to reach 1 billion euro (US$1.1 billion) in assets by 2030 and plans to open two offices in the US.
- A US-focused growth fund will be launched, targeting investments between US$5 million and US$10 million in larger growth rounds of US$50 million or more.
